trans-unit.source: Set up protection between an on-premises Hyper-V site and Azure
trans-unit.target: Set up protection between an on-premises Hyper-V site and Azure

trans-unit.source: Azure Site Recovery coordinates the replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines located on on-premises Hyper-V servers to Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure Site Recovery coordinates the replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines located on on-premises Hyper-V servers to Azure

trans-unit.source: Set up protection between an on-premises Hyper-V site and Azure
trans-unit.target: Set up protection between an on-premises Hyper-V site and Azure

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Azure Site Recovery contributes to your business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) strategy by orchestrating replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines and physical servers.
trans-unit.target: Azure Site Recovery contributes to your business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) strategy by orchestrating replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines and physical servers.

trans-unit.source: Read about possible deployment scenarios in the [Site Recovery Overview](site-recovery-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: Read about possible deployment scenarios in the [Site Recovery Overview](site-recovery-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: This article describes how to deploy Site Recovery to replicate virtual machines located on on-premises Hyper-V servers running Windows Server 2012 R2.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to deploy Site Recovery to replicate virtual machines located on on-premises Hyper-V servers running Windows Server 2012 R2.

trans-unit.source: Replication to Azure storage is orchestrated by Site Recovery.
trans-unit.target: Replication to Azure storage is orchestrated by Site Recovery.

trans-unit.source: This deployment is particularly useful if you're running Hyper-V servers but System Center Virtual Machine Manager (VMM) isn't deployed.
trans-unit.target: This deployment is particularly useful if you're running Hyper-V servers but System Center Virtual Machine Manager (VMM) isn't deployed.

trans-unit.source: About this article
trans-unit.target: About this article

trans-unit.source: The article summarizes the deployment prerequisites, helps you to configure replication settings, and enable protection for virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: The article summarizes the deployment prerequisites, helps you to configure replication settings, and enable protection for virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: It finishes up by testing failover to make sure everything's working as expected.
trans-unit.target: It finishes up by testing failover to make sure everything's working as expected.

trans-unit.source: If you run into problems post your questions on the [Azure Recovery Services Forum](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/forums/azure/home?forum=hypervrecovmgr).
trans-unit.target: If you run into problems post your questions on the [Azure Recovery Services Forum](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/forums/azure/home?forum=hypervrecovmgr).

trans-unit.source: Before you start
trans-unit.target: Before you start

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have everything in place before you begin.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have everything in place before you begin.

trans-unit.source: Azure prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Azure prerequisites

trans-unit.source: You'll need a [Microsoft Azure](http://azure.microsoft.com/) account.
trans-unit.target: You'll need a [Microsoft Azure](http://azure.microsoft.com/) account.

trans-unit.source: You can start with a [free trial](pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: You can start with a [free trial](pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: You'll need an Azure storage account to store replicated data.
trans-unit.target: You'll need an Azure storage account to store replicated data.

trans-unit.source: The account needs geo-replication enabled.
trans-unit.target: The account needs geo-replication enabled.

trans-unit.source: It should be in the same region as the Azure Site Recovery vault and be associated with the same subscription.
trans-unit.target: It should be in the same region as the Azure Site Recovery vault and be associated with the same subscription.

trans-unit.source: To learn more read [Introduction to Microsoft Azure Storage](../storage/storage-introduction.md).
trans-unit.target: To learn more read [Introduction to Microsoft Azure Storage](../storage/storage-introduction.md).

trans-unit.source: You'll need an Azure virtual network so that replicated virtual machines are connected to a network after failover.
trans-unit.target: You'll need an Azure virtual network so that replicated virtual machines are connected to a network after failover.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V prerequisites

trans-unit.source: In the source on-premises site you'll need at least one server running Windows Server 2012 R2 with the Hyper-V role.
trans-unit.target: In the source on-premises site you'll need at least one server running Windows Server 2012 R2 with the Hyper-V role.

trans-unit.source: The Hyper-V server should contain one or more virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: The Hyper-V server should contain one or more virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V servers should be connected to the Internet, either directly or via a proxy.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V servers should be connected to the Internet, either directly or via a proxy.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Virtual machines you want to protect should conform with [Azure prerequisites](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn469078.aspx#BKMK_E2A).
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines you want to protect should conform with [Azure prerequisites](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn469078.aspx#BKMK_E2A).

trans-unit.source: Provider and agent prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Provider and agent prerequisites

trans-unit.source: As part of Azure Site Recovery deployment you’ll install the Azure Site Recovery Provider and the Azure Recovery Services Agent on each Hyper-V server running virtual machines you want to protect.
trans-unit.target: As part of Azure Site Recovery deployment you’ll install the Azure Site Recovery Provider and the Azure Recovery Services Agent on each Hyper-V server running virtual machines you want to protect.

trans-unit.source: Note that:
trans-unit.target: Note that:

trans-unit.source: You should run the latest versions of the Provider and agent.
trans-unit.target: You should run the latest versions of the Provider and agent.

trans-unit.source: All Hyper-V servers in a vault should have the same versions.
trans-unit.target: All Hyper-V servers in a vault should have the same versions.

trans-unit.source: The Provider will need to connect to Azure Site Recovery over the Internet.
trans-unit.target: The Provider will need to connect to Azure Site Recovery over the Internet.

trans-unit.source: You can select to do this without a proxy, using proxy settings currently configured on the VMM server, or using custom proxy settings that you configure during Provider installation.
trans-unit.target: You can select to do this without a proxy, using proxy settings currently configured on the VMM server, or using custom proxy settings that you configure during Provider installation.

trans-unit.source: To use an existing proxy server ensure that the URLs for connecting to Azure are allowed through the firewall:
trans-unit.target: To use an existing proxy server ensure that the URLs for connecting to Azure are allowed through the firewall:

trans-unit.source: *.hypervrecoverymanager.windowsazure.com
trans-unit.target: *.hypervrecoverymanager.windowsazure.com

trans-unit.source: *.accesscontrol.windows.net
trans-unit.target: *.accesscontrol.windows.net

trans-unit.source: *.backup.windowsazure.com
trans-unit.target: *.backup.windowsazure.com

trans-unit.source: *.blob.core.windows.net
trans-unit.target: *.blob.core.windows.net

trans-unit.source: *.store.core.windows.net
trans-unit.target: *.store.core.windows.net

trans-unit.source: To use a custom proxy set up the proxy server before installing the Provider.
trans-unit.target: To use a custom proxy set up the proxy server before installing the Provider.

trans-unit.source: During Provider setup you’ll need to specify the proxy server address and port, and credentials that can be used for access.
trans-unit.target: During Provider setup you’ll need to specify the proxy server address and port, and credentials that can be used for access.

trans-unit.source: Note that HTTPS based proxy is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Note that HTTPS based proxy is not supported.

trans-unit.source: The picture below shows the different communication channels and ports used by Azure Site Recovery for orchestration and replication
trans-unit.target: The picture below shows the different communication channels and ports used by Azure Site Recovery for orchestration and replication

trans-unit.source: B2A Topology
trans-unit.target: B2A Topology

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Create a vault
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Create a vault

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Management Portal](https://portal.azure.com).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Management Portal](https://portal.azure.com).

trans-unit.source: Expand **Data Services** > **Recovery Services** and click **Site Recovery Vault**.
trans-unit.target: Expand **Data Services** > **Recovery Services** and click **Site Recovery Vault**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create New** > **Quick Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create New** > **Quick Create**.

trans-unit.source: In **Name**, enter a friendly name to identify the vault.
trans-unit.target: In **Name**, enter a friendly name to identify the vault.

trans-unit.source: In **Region**, select the geographic region for the vault.
trans-unit.target: In **Region**, select the geographic region for the vault.

trans-unit.source: To check supported regions see Geographic Availability in [Azure Site Recovery Pricing Details](pricing/details/site-recovery/).
trans-unit.target: To check supported regions see Geographic Availability in [Azure Site Recovery Pricing Details](pricing/details/site-recovery/).

trans-unit.source: Click **Create vault**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create vault**.

trans-unit.source: New vault
trans-unit.target: New vault

trans-unit.source: Check the status bar to confirm that the vault was successfully created.
trans-unit.target: Check the status bar to confirm that the vault was successfully created.

trans-unit.source: The vault will be listed as **Active** on the main Recovery Services page.
trans-unit.target: The vault will be listed as **Active** on the main Recovery Services page.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Create a Hyper-V site
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Create a Hyper-V site

trans-unit.source: In the Recovery Services page, click the vault to open the Quick Start page.
trans-unit.target: In the Recovery Services page, click the vault to open the Quick Start page.

trans-unit.source: Quick Start can also be opened at any time using the icon.
trans-unit.target: Quick Start can also be opened at any time using the icon.

trans-unit.source: Quick Start
trans-unit.target: Quick Start

trans-unit.source: In the dropdown list, select **Between an on-premises Hyper-V site and Azure**.
trans-unit.target: In the dropdown list, select **Between an on-premises Hyper-V site and Azure**.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V site scenario
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V site scenario

trans-unit.source: In **Create a Hyper-V Site** click **Create Hyper-V site**.
trans-unit.target: In **Create a Hyper-V Site** click **Create Hyper-V site**.

trans-unit.source: Specify a site name and save.
trans-unit.target: Specify a site name and save.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V site
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V site

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Install the Provider and agent
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Install the Provider and agent

trans-unit.source: Install the Provider and agent.
trans-unit.target: Install the Provider and agent.

trans-unit.source: If you're installing on a Hyper-V cluster, performs steps 5-11 on each node in the failover cluster.
trans-unit.target: If you're installing on a Hyper-V cluster, performs steps 5-11 on each node in the failover cluster.

trans-unit.source: After all nodes are registered and protection is enabled, virtual machines will be protected even if they migrate across nodes in the failover cluster.
trans-unit.target: After all nodes are registered and protection is enabled, virtual machines will be protected even if they migrate across nodes in the failover cluster.

trans-unit.source: In **Prepare Hyper-V servers**, click **Download a registration key** file.
trans-unit.target: In **Prepare Hyper-V servers**, click **Download a registration key** file.

trans-unit.source: On the **Download Registration Key** page, click **Download** next to the site.
trans-unit.target: On the **Download Registration Key** page, click **Download** next to the site.

trans-unit.source: Download the key to a safe location that can be easily accessed by the Hyper-V server.
trans-unit.target: Download the key to a safe location that can be easily accessed by the Hyper-V server.

trans-unit.source: The key is valid for 5 days after it's generated.
trans-unit.target: The key is valid for 5 days after it's generated.

trans-unit.source: Registration key
trans-unit.target: Registration key

trans-unit.source: Click **Download the Provider** to obtain the latest version.
trans-unit.target: Click **Download the Provider** to obtain the latest version.

trans-unit.source: Run the file on each Hyper-V server you want to register in the vault.
trans-unit.target: Run the file on each Hyper-V server you want to register in the vault.

trans-unit.source: The file installs two components:
trans-unit.target: The file installs two components:

trans-unit.source: **Azure Site Recovery Provider**—Handles communication and orchestration between the Hyper-V server and the Azure Site Recovery portal.
trans-unit.target: **Azure Site Recovery Provider**—Handles communication and orchestration between the Hyper-V server and the Azure Site Recovery portal.

trans-unit.source: **Azure Recovery Services Agent**—Handles data transport between virtual machines running on the source Hyper-V server and Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: **Azure Recovery Services Agent**—Handles data transport between virtual machines running on the source Hyper-V server and Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: In **Microsoft Update** you can opt in for updates.
trans-unit.target: In **Microsoft Update** you can opt in for updates.

trans-unit.source: With this setting enabled, Provider and Agent updates will be installed according to your Microsoft Update policy.
trans-unit.target: With this setting enabled, Provider and Agent updates will be installed according to your Microsoft Update policy.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Updates
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Updates

trans-unit.source: In **Installation** specify where you want to install the Provider and Agent on the Hyper-V server.
trans-unit.target: In **Installation** specify where you want to install the Provider and Agent on the Hyper-V server.

trans-unit.source: Install location
trans-unit.target: Install location

trans-unit.source: After installation is complete continue setup to register the server in the vault.
trans-unit.target: After installation is complete continue setup to register the server in the vault.

trans-unit.source: Installation complete
trans-unit.target: Installation complete

trans-unit.source: On the **Internet Connection** page you specify how the Provider connects to Azure Site Recovery.
trans-unit.target: On the **Internet Connection** page you specify how the Provider connects to Azure Site Recovery.

trans-unit.source: Select **Use default system proxy settings** to use the default Internet connection settings configured on the server.
trans-unit.target: Select **Use default system proxy settings** to use the default Internet connection settings configured on the server.

trans-unit.source: If you don't specify a value the default settings will be used.
trans-unit.target: If you don't specify a value the default settings will be used.

trans-unit.source: Internet Settings
trans-unit.target: Internet Settings

trans-unit.source: Note that:
trans-unit.target: Note that:

trans-unit.source: If the default proxy on the Hyper-V server requires authentication then you should select to use a custom proxy server.
trans-unit.target: If the default proxy on the Hyper-V server requires authentication then you should select to use a custom proxy server.

trans-unit.source: Type in the default proxy details and specify credentials.
trans-unit.target: Type in the default proxy details and specify credentials.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use a custom proxy server set it up before you install the Provider.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use a custom proxy server set it up before you install the Provider.

trans-unit.source: Following urls should be accessible from Hyper-v host
trans-unit.target: Following urls should be accessible from Hyper-v host

trans-unit.source: *.hypervrecoverymanager.windowsazure.com
trans-unit.target: *.hypervrecoverymanager.windowsazure.com

trans-unit.source: *.accesscontrol.windows.net
trans-unit.target: *.accesscontrol.windows.net

trans-unit.source: *.backup.windowsazure.com
trans-unit.target: *.backup.windowsazure.com

trans-unit.source: *.blob.core.windows.net
trans-unit.target: *.blob.core.windows.net

trans-unit.source: *.store.core.windows.net
trans-unit.target: *.store.core.windows.net

trans-unit.source: Allow the IP addresses described in [Azure Datacenter IP Ranges](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=511094) and HTTPS (443) protocol.
trans-unit.target: Allow the IP addresses described in [Azure Datacenter IP Ranges](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=511094) and HTTPS (443) protocol.

trans-unit.source: You would have to white-list IP ranges of the Azure region that you plan to use and that of West US.
trans-unit.target: You would have to white-list IP ranges of the Azure region that you plan to use and that of West US.

trans-unit.source: On the **Vault Settings** page, click **Browse** to select the key file.
trans-unit.target: On the **Vault Settings** page, click **Browse** to select the key file.

trans-unit.source: Specify the Azure Site Recovery subscription, the vault name, and the Hyper-V site to which the Hyper-V server belongs.
trans-unit.target: Specify the Azure Site Recovery subscription, the vault name, and the Hyper-V site to which the Hyper-V server belongs.

trans-unit.source: Server registration
trans-unit.target: Server registration

trans-unit.source: Registration starts to register the server in the vault.
trans-unit.target: Registration starts to register the server in the vault.

trans-unit.source: Server registration
trans-unit.target: Server registration

trans-unit.source: After registration finishes metadata from the Hyper-V server is retrieved by Azure Site Recovery and the server is displayed on the **Hyper-V Sites** tab on the **Servers** page in the vault.
trans-unit.target: After registration finishes metadata from the Hyper-V server is retrieved by Azure Site Recovery and the server is displayed on the **Hyper-V Sites** tab on the **Servers** page in the vault.

trans-unit.source: Server registration
trans-unit.target: Server registration

trans-unit.source: Note that if you want to install the Provider on Server Core for Windows Server 2012 R2 or standalone Hyper-V Server 2012 R2, do the following:
trans-unit.target: Note that if you want to install the Provider on Server Core for Windows Server 2012 R2 or standalone Hyper-V Server 2012 R2, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Download the Provider installation file and the registration key to a folder say C:\ASR .
trans-unit.target: Download the Provider installation file and the registration key to a folder say C:\ASR .

trans-unit.source: Extract the Provider installer by typing:
trans-unit.target: Extract the Provider installer by typing:

trans-unit.source: Install the Provider by typing:
trans-unit.target: Install the Provider by typing:

trans-unit.source: Register the server by typing:
trans-unit.target: Register the server by typing:

trans-unit.source: /Credentials: Mandatory parameter that specifies the location in which the registration key file is located.
trans-unit.target: /Credentials: Mandatory parameter that specifies the location in which the registration key file is located.

trans-unit.source: /FriendlyName: Mandatory parameter for the name of the Hyper-V host server that appears in the Azure Site Recovery portal.
trans-unit.target: /FriendlyName: Mandatory parameter for the name of the Hyper-V host server that appears in the Azure Site Recovery portal.

trans-unit.source: Optional proxy parameters:
trans-unit.target: Optional proxy parameters:

trans-unit.source: /proxyAddress
trans-unit.target: /proxyAddress

trans-unit.source: : Address of proxy server
trans-unit.target: : Address of proxy server

trans-unit.source: /proxyport
trans-unit.target: /proxyport

trans-unit.source: : Port of the proxy server
trans-unit.target: : Port of the proxy server

trans-unit.source: /proxyUsername
trans-unit.target: /proxyUsername

trans-unit.source: : Credentials if proxy requires authentication.
trans-unit.target: : Credentials if proxy requires authentication.

trans-unit.source: proxyPassword
trans-unit.target: proxyPassword

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]You can configure each of the individual Hyper-V host to use different network bandwidth settings to replicate virtual machines to Azure.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]You can configure each of the individual Hyper-V host to use different network bandwidth settings to replicate virtual machines to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [How to Manage on-premises to Azure protection network bandwidth usage](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/3056159)
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [How to Manage on-premises to Azure protection network bandwidth usage](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/3056159)

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Create Azure resources
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Create Azure resources

trans-unit.source: In **Prepare resources** select **Create Storage Account** to create an Azure storage account if you don't have one.
trans-unit.target: In **Prepare resources** select **Create Storage Account** to create an Azure storage account if you don't have one.

trans-unit.source: The account should have geo-replication enabled.
trans-unit.target: The account should have geo-replication enabled.

trans-unit.source: It should be in the same region as the Azure Site Recovery vault, and be associated with the same subscription.
trans-unit.target: It should be in the same region as the Azure Site Recovery vault, and be associated with the same subscription.

trans-unit.source: Create storage account
trans-unit.target: Create storage account

trans-unit.source: Step 5: Create and configure protection groups
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Create and configure protection groups

trans-unit.source: Protection groups are logical groupings of virtual machines that you want to protect using the same protection settings.
trans-unit.target: Protection groups are logical groupings of virtual machines that you want to protect using the same protection settings.

trans-unit.source: You apply protection settings to a protection group, and those settings are applied to all virtual machines that you add to the group.
trans-unit.target: You apply protection settings to a protection group, and those settings are applied to all virtual machines that you add to the group.

trans-unit.source: In **Create and configure protection groups** click **Create a protection group**.
trans-unit.target: In **Create and configure protection groups** click **Create a protection group**.

trans-unit.source: If any prerequisites aren't in place a message is issued and you can click **View details** for more information.
trans-unit.target: If any prerequisites aren't in place a message is issued and you can click **View details** for more information.

trans-unit.source: In the **Protection Groups** tab, add a protection group.
trans-unit.target: In the **Protection Groups** tab, add a protection group.

trans-unit.source: Specify a name, the source Hyper-V site, the target **Azure**, your Azure Site Recovery subscription name, and the Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: Specify a name, the source Hyper-V site, the target **Azure**, your Azure Site Recovery subscription name, and the Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: Protection group
trans-unit.target: Protection group

trans-unit.source: In **Replication settings** set the **Copy frequency** to specify how often the data delta should be synchronized between the source and target.
trans-unit.target: In **Replication settings** set the **Copy frequency** to specify how often the data delta should be synchronized between the source and target.

trans-unit.source: You can set to 30 seconds, 5 minutes, or 15 minutes.
trans-unit.target: You can set to 30 seconds, 5 minutes, or 15 minutes.

trans-unit.source: In **Retain recovery points** specify how many hours of recovery history should be stored.
trans-unit.target: In **Retain recovery points** specify how many hours of recovery history should be stored.

trans-unit.source: In **Frequency of application-consistent snapshots** you can specify whether to take snapshots that use Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) to ensure that applications are in a consistent state when the snapshot is taken.
trans-unit.target: In **Frequency of application-consistent snapshots** you can specify whether to take snapshots that use Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) to ensure that applications are in a consistent state when the snapshot is taken.

trans-unit.source: By default these aren't taken.
trans-unit.target: By default these aren't taken.

trans-unit.source: Make sure this value is set to less than the number of additional recovery points you configure.
trans-unit.target: Make sure this value is set to less than the number of additional recovery points you configure.

trans-unit.source: This is only supported if the virtual machine is running a Windows operating system.
trans-unit.target: This is only supported if the virtual machine is running a Windows operating system.

trans-unit.source: In **Initial replication start time** specify when initial replication of virtual machines in the protection group should be sent to Azure.
trans-unit.target: In **Initial replication start time** specify when initial replication of virtual machines in the protection group should be sent to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Protection group
trans-unit.target: Protection group

trans-unit.source: Step 6: Enable virtual machine protection
trans-unit.target: Step 6: Enable virtual machine protection

trans-unit.source: Add virtual machines to a protection group to enable protection for them.
trans-unit.target: Add virtual machines to a protection group to enable protection for them.

trans-unit.source: On the **Machines** tab for the protection group, click** Add virtual machines to protection groups to enable protection**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Machines** tab for the protection group, click** Add virtual machines to protection groups to enable protection**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Enable Virtual Machine Protection** page select the virtual machines you want to protect.
trans-unit.target: On the **Enable Virtual Machine Protection** page select the virtual machines you want to protect.

trans-unit.source: Enable virtual machine protection
trans-unit.target: Enable virtual machine protection

trans-unit.source: The Enable Protection jobs begins.
trans-unit.target: The Enable Protection jobs begins.

trans-unit.source: You can track progress on the **Jobs** tab.
trans-unit.target: You can track progress on the **Jobs** tab.

trans-unit.source: After the Finalize Protection job runs the virtual machine is ready for failover.
trans-unit.target: After the Finalize Protection job runs the virtual machine is ready for failover.

trans-unit.source: After protection is set up you can:
trans-unit.target: After protection is set up you can:

trans-unit.source: View virtual machines in **Protected Items** > **Protection Groups** > *protectiongroup_name* > **Virtual Machines** You can drill down to machine details in the **Properties** tab..
trans-unit.target: View virtual machines in **Protected Items** > **Protection Groups** > *protectiongroup_name* > **Virtual Machines** You can drill down to machine details in the **Properties** tab..

trans-unit.source: Configure the failover properties for a virtual machines in **Protected Items** > **Protection Groups** > *protectiongroup_name* > **Virtual Machines** *virtual_machine_name* > **Configure**.
trans-unit.target: Configure the failover properties for a virtual machines in **Protected Items** > **Protection Groups** > *protectiongroup_name* > **Virtual Machines** *virtual_machine_name* > **Configure**.

trans-unit.source: You can configure:
trans-unit.target: You can configure:

trans-unit.source: **Name**: The name of the virtual machine in Azure.
trans-unit.target: **Name**: The name of the virtual machine in Azure.

trans-unit.source: **Size**: The target size of the virtual machine that fails over.
trans-unit.target: **Size**: The target size of the virtual machine that fails over.

trans-unit.source: Configure virtual machine properties
trans-unit.target: Configure virtual machine properties

trans-unit.source: Configure additional virtual machine settings in *Protected Items** > **Protection Groups** > *protectiongroup_name* > **Virtual Machines** *virtual_machine_name* > **Configure**, including:
trans-unit.target: Configure additional virtual machine settings in *Protected Items** > **Protection Groups** > *protectiongroup_name* > **Virtual Machines** *virtual_machine_name* > **Configure**, including:

trans-unit.source: **Network adapters**: The number of network adapters is dictated by the size you specify for the target virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: **Network adapters**: The number of network adapters is dictated by the size you specify for the target virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Large (A3) and A6: 2
trans-unit.target: Large (A3) and A6: 2

trans-unit.source: ExtraLarge (A4) and A7:
trans-unit.target: ExtraLarge (A4) and A7:

trans-unit.source: When you modify the size for a virtual machine and save the settings, the next time you open the **Configure** page the network adapters will be shown.
trans-unit.target: When you modify the size for a virtual machine and save the settings, the next time you open the **Configure** page the network adapters will be shown.

trans-unit.source: The number of adapters for a virtual machine will be determined as follows:
trans-unit.target: The number of adapters for a virtual machine will be determined as follows:

trans-unit.source: Step 7: Create a recovery plan
trans-unit.target: Step 7: Create a recovery plan

trans-unit.source: In order to test the deployment you can run a test failover for a single virtual machine or a recovery plan that contains one or more virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: In order to test the deployment you can run a test failover for a single virtual machine or a recovery plan that contains one or more virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: To create a recovery plan [follow these instructions](site-recovery-create-recovery-plans.md)
trans-unit.target: To create a recovery plan [follow these instructions](site-recovery-create-recovery-plans.md)

trans-unit.source: Step 8: Test the deployment
trans-unit.target: Step 8: Test the deployment

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to run a test failover to Azure.
trans-unit.target: There are two ways to run a test failover to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Test failover without an Azure network—This type of test failover checks that the virtual machine comes up correctly in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Test failover without an Azure network—This type of test failover checks that the virtual machine comes up correctly in Azure.

trans-unit.source: The virtual machine won’t be connected to any Azure network after failover.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machine won’t be connected to any Azure network after failover.

trans-unit.source: Test failover with an Azure network—This type of failover checks that the entire replication environment comes up as expected and that failed over the virtual machines will be connected to the specified target Azure network.
trans-unit.target: Test failover with an Azure network—This type of failover checks that the entire replication environment comes up as expected and that failed over the virtual machines will be connected to the specified target Azure network.

trans-unit.source: For subnet handling, for test failover the subnet of the test virtual machine will be figured out based on the subnet of the replica virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: For subnet handling, for test failover the subnet of the test virtual machine will be figured out based on the subnet of the replica virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: This is different to regular replication when the subnet of a replica virtual machine is based on the subnet of the source virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This is different to regular replication when the subnet of a replica virtual machine is based on the subnet of the source virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: If you want to run a test failover for a virtual machine enabled for protection to Azure without specifying an Azure target network you don’t need to prepare anything.
trans-unit.target: If you want to run a test failover for a virtual machine enabled for protection to Azure without specifying an Azure target network you don’t need to prepare anything.

trans-unit.source: To run a test failover with a target Azure network you’ll need to create a new Azure network that’s isolated from your Azure production network (default behavior when you create a new network in Azure) and set up the infrastructure for the replicated virtual machine to work as expected.
trans-unit.target: To run a test failover with a target Azure network you’ll need to create a new Azure network that’s isolated from your Azure production network (default behavior when you create a new network in Azure) and set up the infrastructure for the replicated virtual machine to work as expected.

trans-unit.source: For example, a virtual machine with Domain Controller and DNS can be replicated to Azure using Azure Site Recovery and can be created in the test network using Test Failover.
trans-unit.target: For example, a virtual machine with Domain Controller and DNS can be replicated to Azure using Azure Site Recovery and can be created in the test network using Test Failover.

trans-unit.source: To run a test failover follow the steps below:
trans-unit.target: To run a test failover follow the steps below:

trans-unit.source: Do a test failover of the virtual machine with Domain Controller and DNS in the same network that you’ll be using for the actual test failover of the on-premises virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Do a test failover of the virtual machine with Domain Controller and DNS in the same network that you’ll be using for the actual test failover of the on-premises virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Note down the IP addresses that were allocated to the failed over DNS virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Note down the IP addresses that were allocated to the failed over DNS virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure virtual network that will be used for the failover, add the IP address as the address of the DNS server.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure virtual network that will be used for the failover, add the IP address as the address of the DNS server.

trans-unit.source: Run the test failover of the source on-premises virtual machines, specifying the Azure test network.
trans-unit.target: Run the test failover of the source on-premises virtual machines, specifying the Azure test network.

trans-unit.source: After validating that the test failure worked as expected, mark the test failover as complete for the recovery plan, and then mark the test failover as complete for the Domain Controller and DNS virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: After validating that the test failure worked as expected, mark the test failover as complete for the recovery plan, and then mark the test failover as complete for the Domain Controller and DNS virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: To run the test failover do the following:
trans-unit.target: To run the test failover do the following:

trans-unit.source: On the **Recovery Plans** tab, select the plan and click **Test Failover**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Recovery Plans** tab, select the plan and click **Test Failover**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Confirm Test Failover** page select **None** or a specific Azure network.
trans-unit.target: On the **Confirm Test Failover** page select **None** or a specific Azure network.

trans-unit.source: Note that if you select **None** the test failover will check that the virtual machine replicated correctly to Azure but doesn't check your replication network configuration.
trans-unit.target: Note that if you select **None** the test failover will check that the virtual machine replicated correctly to Azure but doesn't check your replication network configuration.

trans-unit.source: Test failover
trans-unit.target: Test failover

trans-unit.source: On the **Jobs** tab you can track failover progress.
trans-unit.target: On the **Jobs** tab you can track failover progress.

trans-unit.source: You should also be able to see the virtual machine test replica in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: You should also be able to see the virtual machine test replica in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: If you’re set up to access virtual machines from your on-premises network you can initiate a Remote Desktop connection to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: If you’re set up to access virtual machines from your on-premises network you can initiate a Remote Desktop connection to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: When the failover reaches the **Complete testing** phase , click **Complete Test** to finish up the test failover.
trans-unit.target: When the failover reaches the **Complete testing** phase , click **Complete Test** to finish up the test failover.

trans-unit.source: You can drill down to the **Job** tab to track failover progress and status, and to perform any actions that are needed.
trans-unit.target: You can drill down to the **Job** tab to track failover progress and status, and to perform any actions that are needed.

trans-unit.source: After failover you'll be able to see the virtual machine test replica in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: After failover you'll be able to see the virtual machine test replica in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: If you’re set up to access virtual machines from your on-premises network you can initiate a Remote Desktop connection to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: If you’re set up to access virtual machines from your on-premises network you can initiate a Remote Desktop connection to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the virtual machines start successfully.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the virtual machines start successfully.

trans-unit.source: If you want to connect to the virtual machine in Azure using Remote Desktop after the failover, enable Remote Desktop Connection on the virtual machine before you run the test failover.
trans-unit.target: If you want to connect to the virtual machine in Azure using Remote Desktop after the failover, enable Remote Desktop Connection on the virtual machine before you run the test failover.

trans-unit.source: You will also need to add an RDP endpoint on the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: You will also need to add an RDP endpoint on the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You can leverage an [Azure Automation Runbooks](site-recovery-runbook-automation.md) to do that.
trans-unit.target: You can leverage an [Azure Automation Runbooks](site-recovery-runbook-automation.md) to do that.

trans-unit.source: After failover if you use a public IP address to connect to the virtual machine in Azure using Remote Desktop, ensure you don't have any domain policies that prevent you from connecting to a virtual machine using a public address.
trans-unit.target: After failover if you use a public IP address to connect to the virtual machine in Azure using Remote Desktop, ensure you don't have any domain policies that prevent you from connecting to a virtual machine using a public address.

trans-unit.source: After the testing is complete do the following:
trans-unit.target: After the testing is complete do the following:

trans-unit.source: Click **The test failover is complete**.
trans-unit.target: Click **The test failover is complete**.

trans-unit.source: Clean up the test environment to automatically power off and delete the test virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: Clean up the test environment to automatically power off and delete the test virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Click **Notes** to record and save any observations associated with the test failover.
trans-unit.target: Click **Notes** to record and save any observations associated with the test failover.

trans-unit.source: When the failover reaches the **Complete testing** phase finish the verification as follows:
trans-unit.target: When the failover reaches the **Complete testing** phase finish the verification as follows:

trans-unit.source: View the replica virtual machine in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: View the replica virtual machine in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the virtual machine starts successfully.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the virtual machine starts successfully.

trans-unit.source: If you’re set up to access virtual machines from your on-premises network you can initiate a Remote Desktop connection to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: If you’re set up to access virtual machines from your on-premises network you can initiate a Remote Desktop connection to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Click **Complete the test** to finish it.
trans-unit.target: Click **Complete the test** to finish it.

trans-unit.source: Click **Notes** to record and save any observations associated with the test failover.
trans-unit.target: Click **Notes** to record and save any observations associated with the test failover.

trans-unit.source: Click **The test failover is complete**.
trans-unit.target: Click **The test failover is complete**.

trans-unit.source: Clean up the test environment to automatically power off and delete the test virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Clean up the test environment to automatically power off and delete the test virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: After your deployment is set up and running, [learn more](site-recovery-failover.md) about failover.
trans-unit.target: After your deployment is set up and running, [learn more](site-recovery-failover.md) about failover.
